page.title: 04Languages by Helen Priestley
page.content: Today's generation speaks in{slang.} It's done by running words together and changing the meaning of words to suit the situation. For example{Wally. This used to be a popular name, today it means an ignorant person. Swear words are frequently used to show dissatisfaction, pleasure or to hurt another person. Many swear words are blasphemous such as "Jesus Wept". A lot of today's speech is from America, like "hassle" which means to trouble. The upper classes have different accents or styles of pronouncing words to show they have been brought up in a rich community. In 1985 it's good being able to speak in more than one foreign language. These languages are taught in schools. Speaking foreign languages increases the chances of getting jobs abroad.
